intro: Flemingia bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutanese Flemingia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Bhutan and India. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is often used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are encased in pods and can be used as a food source in some local communities. Flemingia bhutanica plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various small organisms.
